intro: Agave petskinil, commonly known as the Mexican century plant, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that form a rosette shape. The plant stores water in its leaves, allowing it to survive in dry environments. It produces a tall flower stalk that can reach several meters in height, bearing white or yellow flowers. Agave petskinil is also known for its ability to regenerate from its base after flowering, making it a long-lived plant.
